relationships.evidence_text: Welcome to the Why On Earth Community Podcast. I'm your host, Aaron William Perry.
we're visiting with the founder of Engineers Without Borders, Bernard Amade.
Dr. Bernard Amade is a distinguished professor and professor of civil engineering.
and professor of civil engineering at the University of Colorado at Boulder.
He received his PhD in 1982 from the University of California at Berkeley.

relationships.target: Mortensen Center for Engineering for Developing Communities
relationships.evidence_text: Dr. Amade is the founding director of the Mortensen Center and Engineering for developing communities.

evidence.target_surface: Mortensen Center for Engineering for Developing Communities

relationships.evidence_text: He is also the founding president of Engineers Without Borders USA.
and the co-founder of the Engineers Without Borders International Network.
Dr. Amade is an elected member of the US National Academy of Engineering.
and the National Academy of Construction.
He's also an elected senior Ashoka fellow.
